content:
A #new members stream is great for onboarding new members.

If you're reading this and aren't the first person here, introduce yourself in a new thread using your name as the topic! Type c or click on New Topic at the bottom of the screen to start a new topic.
Hi there
hi. yet another chat I see XD
Is everything migrating over from Discord or what?
discord was technically temporary shrug
/me is so confused, is this stream specific to Rust stuff?
I've been assuming that #new members was for anyone on Zulipchat
Everything in this is specific to Rust.
It's similar to discord in that this is our "server"
How can I see the server info in the UI?
hm, possibly in the upper right hand corner there's a gear, but if you're using the web version then it's rust-lang.zulipchat.com which is clearly specific to us :)

i.e. when I look at the stream settings here, I don't see anything about a server specific to rust, so I had assumed this was general Zulip stuff. (Which I can see the #announce and #zulip streams are in a separate area of the left-hand panel, but I don't know how that panel is arranged)
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#organization/organization-profile
(no idea if that'll work for you)
I'm still trying to figure out where one sees rust-lang.zulipchat.com from the pop-up that comes when I click the gear
I see that because I use Zulip in the browser.
pasted image
my web browser page doesn't show it
OH in the url!
okay
oh so even #zulip and #announce are rust-specific
I see, there's also the gear in the upper right side of the whole UI

The panel on the left just shows all the streams you have joined, and optionally at the top streams that you have pinned. The whole server is for the Rust organization and all the streams in it are specific to us.
I was focused on the gear in the upper right side of the panel on the left
and I had assumed this web interface was somehow hooked into multiple servers
but there's just one server,. and it has multiple streams, which in turn have multiple topics
Yeah, new streams can be created and joined from the gear for the streams and whole server settings (or specific users) with the gear at the top right.
Yeah.
The "primary" Zulip for the Zulip devs is chat.zulipchat.com
I probably understood this right when I first started using zulip, and then immediately forgot

The "primary" Zulip for the Zulip devs is chat.zulipchat.com

" There is no Zulip organization hosted at this subdomain. "
Oops, it is https://chat.zulip.org/ - I just guessed from memory.
I knew it was chat but assumed it has the same domain as ours.
great maybe I can look there to see what people are doing about the problems on iOS
I was chatting with the co-founder of Zulip a few weeks ago briefly, they've got a bunch of people dedicated to the mobile apps as of recently because they're not great.

In particular, https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/137-feedback/topic/rust-project and https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/50-publicity/topic/rust-project - both of which I posted links to in the Internals topics about choosing a chat platform for the Rust project.
this sounds like it might be promising: https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/issues/1888

except I worry that they may not understand that there are scenarios where the most important thing is that you get to zoom to whatever the conversation is that is happening right now, even if it means you skip over the backlog
i.e. if you are participating in a live mtg via chat
I've found I've gotten used to the mobile app more and more, the only thing that still bugs me is that the little green down arrow doesn't take me to "right now".
It seems to paginate in some strange way.

exactly. and the conversations I see indicate that they think the "right way" to use zulip is to always jump solely to the first unread (where I interpret "first" as meaning "first with respect to time")
while you and I want sometimes to jump to now, aka "last unread"
Yeah, that's often what I want to do. They seemed very receptive to feedback when I spoke to them so I'd hope it's something they'd add.
@RalfJ does this look interleaved to you?
oh thats a different stream. aha.
no it doesnt interlave different streams

no it doesnt interlave different streams

weird, it does for me. Like this:

pasted image
oh, ah. it does when I select "all messages"
which I never considered doing^^
There's no way to show messages from multiple streams other than "all messages" so in some regards it doesn't really interleave them.
hmm, maybe the search panel would let you
well hows that not interleaving them?^^
all messages = all streams seems like a reasonable "completion" of the model here
(and also you can get the topics from one stream interleaved by selecting the stream itself)
yes I have seen that
hm, having to click twice is annoying
select stream, then click msg to reply to
Well, yeah, it does interleave them, I just find I rarely use "all messages" so in my normal use it doesn't interleave streams.
also why does it scroll up and leave a bunch of unused white space below the last msg?

hmm, maybe the search panel would let you

answer: no, the search semantics are to take the AND of the criteria, not an OR

select stream, then click msg to reply to

(there is a keyboard interface if that is easier for you than clicking)
The keyboard icon in the bottom right corner brings up the shortcuts.
its still two actions is what I mean
instead of just typing which is what I am used to

instead of just typing which is what I am used to

if you leave the reply box open
then that can make it easier

argh this whitespace drives me crazy^^ I usually just scroll down as far as I can, but here that leave shalf the screen empty so now I have to manually perfectly align the bottommost msg with the screen
(that combined with "Press Enter to send")
has to be perfectly aligned, obviously :P

(that combined with "Press Enter to send")

yeah that as the first thing I did
hmm I hadn't noticed the white space before but now I'm sure its going to annoy me
sorry^^
Though, press enter to send is always set (or never set, I forget) when editing messages. I've got an issue open for that.
its never set for editing
and arrow-up also doesnt edit the last msg
hmm apparently you need to first arrow up and then hit 'i', 'enter' ?
that depends on what you had selected
true
so you want to first jump to your own last message, then?
yeah
argh keyborad navigation screwed up my aligned whitespace :P
apparently 'left' arrow is edit your last message?
(See keyboard shortcuts, either by hitting '?' or by clicking the keyboard icon next to the "Press Enter to Send" checkbox)
thats not where the icon is when that checkox is checked :)
its all the way in the bottom right corner here
That's probably just the screen resolution.
woah so many shortcuts

thats not where the icon is when that checkox is checked :)

ah, yeah, in the web browser interface its on the bottom right like you describe
but in the dedicated (Atom?) app, its screwed up and is squished up next to the "Press Enter to Send" label
I like the general idea I think, but it triggers two things I am kind of (not really) OCD'ing about^^
the whitespace thing and that blue selection box
I usually click in whitespace on websites to get rid of any selection boxes
I dont even notice it any more
but here I (a) cannot get rid of it and (b) clicking in whitespace makes the chat box go away^^
That might be worth a bug report of some kind
it does seem to be unintuitive UI
well its consistent with not having a check box when I enter a stream
oh now it also didnt scroll down when a new msg came. odd?
now I'm waiting to see if it scrolls down for me when I have a message far back in the history selected
test
yeah doesn't seem to.
when you select the bottom it moves up
and then when that moved to the top
Which... makes sense, if my goal is to actually interact with that message
it stops scrolling
hmm
but it means I cannot just keep chatting in a topic
without selecting a new msg all the time
right?
do I really spend all my time clicking more recwent messages without even realizing it?
which certainly doesnt sound right for a chat app
it doesn't seem reasonable
and yet
really right now I am just filling up my screen
I keep typing
and now
to confirm... yes, confirmed
yeah okay this is bad
so I guess I've gotten used to clicking
lol
because I'm often tweaking the most recent messages I've sent
you can of course hit 'G'
to jump to the last message
but that requires killing the reply box
I think it only seems bad when you think about it because it's never been something we've noticed until now.
g opens the menu though
and the whole point right now
so G is two keys to press
is to optimize for having the reply box open
you really distinguish 'g' from 'G' ?
I dont, the website does
you must be a vi user. :)
no i mean in terms of keystrokes
give it some time i guess
@pnkfelix well I am used to shortcuts not having implicit shift
like, Ctrl-V doesnt involve shift
but whoever built this thing though making g and G separate shortcuts was a good idea
which seems rather odd
true, it does seem unintuitive (again)
well I am noticing it very much right now @David Wood and I have to say it is really annoying^^
I cant just, you know, chat
Fair enough.
sigh, niko and i love zulip but @eddyb and @RalfJ are going to make me hate it by pointing out all these flaws
I have to Esc - Shift-G - r all the time
and then half the screen is white^^
@pnkfelix I love parts of it^^
but yeah, selecting a msg seems like the wrong thing
Do you need to Shift-G before r? If you reply from any message in the topic it gets posted at the bottom doesn't it?
test
its not even meaningful, you cannot see which msg was selected
Yeah.
it should be selecting a topic

Do you need to Shift-G before r? If you reply from any message in the topic it gets posted at the bottom doesn't it?

Yes but I cannot see it
because some old message is still selected. which was the latest message 90sec ago.
and then it doesnt scroll to new msgs
I guess once you hit 'r' then you see what topic it was
in the UI
but of course that's easy to overlook
you also see that in the msg view?
there's always a topic box
I see.
(that is, I see what you mean, not that I would see the new message)

(that is, I see what you mean, not that I would see the new message)

:P

there's always a topic box

I can't tell if you're agreeing with me.
but yes, the stream and the topic are in the reply interface?
yeah so I think thats a tiny hange that would make it perfect: allow selecting a topic, and then ne msgs in that opic are scrolled to and it aligns the whitespace
when clicking a topic on the left, select it
keep msg selection, that's actually great for editing the next-to-last msgs without going to the mouse! I love that part. always missed it in other chats.
but always having to have a single msg selected is not reflecting how chat works...

yeah so I think thats a tiny hange that would make it perfect: allow selecting a topic, and then ne msgs in that opic are scrolled to and it aligns the whitespace

This seems like a good feature request

I can't tell if you're agreeing with me.

well you made a factual statement, I wasnt sure where you were going

yeah so I think thats a tiny hange that would make it perfect: allow selecting a topic, and then ne msgs in that opic are scrolled to and it aligns the whitespace

This seems like a good feature request

test
quote and reply is nice :D
and I like how no mouse is needed for all that. msg selection really shines there.
yeah
Ugh, Zulip is really not good. Why are we on it now? The UX is terrible.

do you have some concrete things that are bothering you?

the UX is certainly unusual but it has a couple features I always missed in other chat systems, like threads
Well, mattermost has threads. but Zulip does them way better.
he might be on the app
Even though it took me a minute to get it, I like that streams are opt-in, whereas you can't properly hide channels in Discord

If you mute a channel then enable "hide muted channels" for a server in Discord, it will vanish entirely (unless if someone @ pings you, then it re-appears temporarily). This is my first day using Zulip, but I am quickly warming up to the organization of individual issues from github/specific topics having their own threads. Easy to catch up on some discussions for specific issues on github.
Yeah, keeping context around is a huge win

Also, if I want to follow even a single channel in a category on discord, I can't collapse the category at all. Which results in me having to scroll every time between the general channels at the top, and some of the dev-tools channels at the bottom
yeah the threads are really useful.
@memoryruins the part about channels re-appearing when you are mentioned is not true
I have "hide muted channels" set, nd what happens whne I get mentione di one is that I get a mytserious mention that I cannot follow until I show muted channels again

Strange. I recreated it moments ago to be sure -- the hidden channel re-appeared, grey, and with the red ping box next to it. Regardless, the opt-outs on discord are not obvious, and much less flexible than here.
@memoryruins strange. are you sure you are not talking about collapsed groups?
when I just collapse a group, mentions are shown
but when I have the channels hidden this way -- which hides entire groups -- I do not see anything. You could try mentioning me in a channel that is not in the lang team group.
I tested with the channel muted, muted channels hidden, and the group collapsed in a private server with a second account. I'll ping you in discord in a moment ^^
Nope, the channel does not show up at all.
the mention shwos up in the "@" button at least so I can click there to jump
It might need a tweak in your global user settings or the notif settings you have set for the server
the worst type of granularity, where I can't even suggest the exact combination thats needed
Looking at that, I cannot see anything that should have this effect
ahhh how am I supposed to use this thing
I'm scrolling through the entire history of every channel to get to present day
surely there must be a better way to on-board
(in the mobile app)
I also can't see dates, only times...
and doing so in the nll stream just absolutely destroys the app- hangs, blank screens, crashes...
plus apparently none of this scrolling is even remembered so why bother

the "scroll to bottom" button on mobile is not great https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/issues/1974
and dates is also an open issue for mobile https://github.com/zulip/zulip-mobile/issues/1336 (on desktop, rollover the time for the date)
zulip is nice for individual focused issues on desktop, but the mobile app struggles on my end too
oh weird and your messages don't show up on the whole-stream view, only in the onboarding thread
you might need to click the # on the bottom menu, then "All Streams" on the top right tab that appears, then click the enable #new members to be apart of your all stream view
already done (any this most recent of your messages does show up in the whole-steam view)
Screenshot_20180922-124328.png
How can I translate a MoveOutIndex in a line of code?
@blitzerr (wrong stream/topic â€” but did you get your question answered?)
When posting questions on zulip is it typically recommended to post it as a new topic or post to a new one?
Sorry, i realize now this would probably be more relevant in the zulip channel :frowning:
i know NLL has a general discussion topic, so you can look for that first and see if it exists on your stream

post it as a new topic or post to a new one?

I don't understand the distinction here? But yes I think a new topic per question is a good idea!
